In addition to numerous training exercises, you will also find a search and filter function for exercises, a weekly overview, training collections, an attendance list including statistics, an import/export of training units and a list of favourites. An all-round package to take your next football training to the next level!

Our suggestion for you: 
Download our free lite version to learn about 50 training exercises and all the functions of the coaching app. Moreover, you have the option of activating a free trial month and then subscribing to the premium version with more than 400 exercises including graphics and animation. Planning training has never been so easy!

What do we offer you?
●	The exercise catalogue provides you with detailed descriptions of over 400 game and exercise forms with graphics and animations. 
●	The user-friendly search and filter function makes it much easier for you to find the exercises you are looking for. The exercises are categorised in age groups from U6 to 16+. There are 8 different categories: Fun Games, Technique/Fints, Coordination/Reaction, Passing Games, Game Forms, Goal Shooting, 1 vs. 1 and Outnumbering. 
●	It is possible to create favourite lists, training sessions or even annual plans. 
●	It is possible to import/export the created training units or favourite lists. This makes the exchange of exercises between trainers child's play. 
●	The integrated attendance list helps you to monitor the training attendance of your players. Statistics such as attendance/absence, maximum and average number of players can be exported and printed. 
●	There are two ways to create a training session:

"Plan training": here you can plan the training in detail for the respective age category. Either your own exercises or exercises from the exercise catalogue are selected, assigned to a date and a group and saved.
"Quick training": here you have the possibility to create a high-quality football training with a few clicks within a very short time. The age group and the number of specific exercises are selected by category. Then the random generator selects the appropriate exercises from the exercise catalogue.
